title: font style help
content:
i need an idea for a typographical style that might be used for a jimmy buffet poster. also need font suggestions that go with that historical style. i have to do a paper on the style history and a poster of lyrics.

thanks!

Tina

 [‹ Small!](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905141629/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42295 "Go to previous forum topic") [Serif typeface with personality needed ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905141629/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41382 "Go to next forum topic")
author: tinawhite

comments.content: Jimmy Buffet? There is a font called Margaritaville ( [http://www.fonts101.com/xt\_fontdetails.asp?FID=7907](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905141629/http:/www.fonts101.com/xt_fontdetails.asp?FID=7907 "http://www.fonts101.com/xt\_fontdetails.asp?FID=7907")), although it seems a bit more well-suited for a kids’ coloring book than the king of casualness. Maybe Mistral? Or Hobo? Those fonts embody a laidback summer evening playing a saxophone in a lifeguard tower.
